title: Stereo Reproduction in the Presence of Sample Rate Offsets
author: Srikanth Korse (International Audio Laboratories Erlangen), Andreas Walther (Fraunhofer IIS), Emanuel A. P. Habets (International Audio Laboratories Erlangen), ...
relevance_why: The proposed audio-domain compensation method for sample rate offsets (SROs) can be beneficial for audio quality enhancement and restoration tasks, particularly in multi-device sound reproduction settings common in music and speech processing.
background: The paper addresses the challenge of synchronizing audio playback across wireless loudspeakers, where sample rate offsets lead to perceptual degradation of spatial cues important for spatial audio.
contribution: This paper introduces a method for compensating sample rate offsets in stereo reproduction to preserve spatial audio cues, achieving improved listener experience in distributed playback settings.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily relied on network-based protocols for clock synchronization, which often did not address the perceptual impact of SROs directly.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work uniquely estimates SROs through spatial filtering and compensates for their effects directly in the audio domain, which avoids the need for strict clock synchronization.

key_innovation: The integration of spatial filtering to isolate loudspeaker contributions for accurate SRO estimation is a novel approach in this field.
real_world_impact: This method has the potential to greatly enhance the quality of spatial audio reproduction in home theater systems and wireless music setups, promoting wider adoption of immersive audio technologies.

new_terms.sample rate offsets: **Sample Rate Offsets (SROs)** refer to the differences in playback sample rates between multiple audio devices, which can lead to timing discrepancies in sound reproduction.
new_terms.dynamic weighted average coherence drift: **Dynamic Weighted Average Coherence Drift (DWACD)** is an algorithm used to estimate SROs and analyze the coherence of audio signals over time.
